{{champion:107}} {{champion:67}} you cant even see where they're coming from,how do you position?

{{champion:107}}:  See indicator -> go to your high-cc teammates or under tower.
{{champion:67}}: Her stealth is too short to surprise you unless she's hiding in a bush/fog of war like any other champion. If you're squishy, stay out of her fairly short range, and help cc/blow her up when she reappears after tumble.  If you're tanky, it's a bit harder for me to say (I'm a mage main), but most likely you try to keep yourself positioned between her and your adc/mid.  Tank also helps cc her for the team to blow her up.

Also with regard to your "you cant even see where they're coming from," Rengar gives warning, so you should at least know that he's coming before he arrives, and use that time to run to your teammates/tower.  Vayne's stealth is such a short duration that even if you can't see her, you should have a circle in your mind of where she could be, compare that to where she wants to go, and figure out where she is with that.

Invisibility =/= invincibility

{{champion:107}} go under tower?

There are threads that ask for turret buffs because he's one of the champs that can jump in, kill u in a sec and get out with more than 50% (not at the start but he can do it later or eventually)

I didn't say it was easy.  You'll likely need to blow at least one summoner and hit him with at least one hard cc to turn it around.

Anyways I was talking about positioning against stealth.  If the enemy can dive, kill you, and easily walk out, their stealth is far less relevant to that situation.  If you're under tower, they're much easier to predict as their avenues of attack are narrowed and they're unable to get very close to you without revealing themselves.

I'm not saying these champions are or aren't balanced, but there is optimal positioning against them even when they're stealthed.

Edit: Also I agree that turrets need to be buffed.  Diving is super easy right now, but being under tower is still safer than the middle of nowhere (especially if you take bushes into consideration).

Did this happen last year? I only started playing since last February and I don't remember balancing being this horrendous.

The burst meta was prophesized by the season 6's preseason, where they overhauled the mastery system, and Thunderlords became (and still is to this day) the most used keystone. They proceeded to add Duskblade, Hextech Protobelt, "diversified" the dragons, implemented the first tower bounty, and updated the assassin class. I believe the Burst Meta truly started around 6.18, when they went and balanced purely for the competitive scene by buffing Lee Sin and Lux, and nerfing Taliyah and Shen.

From 5.5, when they introduced Cinderhulk, all the way up until 5.16, the juggernaut update, was one of the best states of balance for the game. Most early game junglers didn't have the pressure they once did, so games actually felt decently paced because tanks actually existed. They introduced great balance changes in response to the meta, like with Black Cleaver changes and the utility mastery tree update. (Except for the blight that was Runeglaive, because it made Ezreal meta as fuck)

But then they introduced the fuck-up that was the Juggernaut update, where Darius reined supreme, and ADCs built Sterak's Gage.

This post should have more upvotes.  This is 100% what has happened to the game since the end of S5.  Damage is out of control and the mastery system overhaul just added damage and power disproportionately to specific champs.  Riot hasn't had a control state to try new things since 5.15, just keep adding more and more stuff and hope it fixes the problems.    

My entire group of friends (8+ people) used to play league until 5.16 and since then they've slowly been quitting the game (A bunch left during the devourer fiasco and then the rest left after the new mastery systems turned the game on its head, the complaints about the game just kept mounting with every change after being in love with the game for years).  My friend who took a year and a half break came back to try it out again and was confused as fuck why some junglers could 100-0 him with no gank assistance and why the jungler was the same level as him.  

Masteries have completely changed the way the game is played and it was not a change that made the game more interesting or more dynamic, it has homogonized how you trade and how you're forced to play the game.  Mid lane is now a three hit thunderlords minigame which has as much influence over who won the trade than the abilities used.  Courage of the colossus gives free health to champions that shouldn't be getting free health.  Winspeaker's blessing has given hidden power to healing/shielding supports and made them significantly strong for over a year now.  

All of this combined has made squishies die faster and tanks die more slowly (part of poppy's problem right now is CoC), no wonder ADCs are just a walking bag of gold.  Riot needs to slow down on making changes and balance the game out, at their current pace the game feels like it is in a state of balance for about 3 months out of the year and the rest of the time you're just hoping the bullshit gets banned.

/EndRant

To be fair, mages were scary as hell too during the juggernaut meta, i don't recall which ones but as a ADC you got sterak to survive oneshots and deny darius his dunking.... also helped that it was both cheap and strong.
Everyone started building tank, it was just most noticable that ADCs (especially the melee ADCs) were doing it to counter the rise of tanks with reliable damage.

What's funny is that if you play Heroes of the Storm, Blizzard seems to understand that concept. Being "bursted" down in Heroes means getting 100-0'd in _3 to 4_ seconds, since mobility is rare in that game and damage is even rarer. There's more than enough time to understand why you died. Not just, "What the fuck just hit me for 3k out of nowhere?"
Most of the problems in league right now originate from {{summoner:4}} and the mobility creep it caused.

I think flash is an important spell to the dynamic of League. What causes problems is when Riot goes, "Well, we have flash, but why don't we give new champs built-in flashes with some gimmick!" I mean, Ezreal isn't at all unbalanced, imo, but seriously, his E is _LITERALLY_ a better version of flash in every way. Longer range. Shorter CD. Damages the nearest enemy on landing. There wasn't even any creativity, Riot were just like, "What if we made one of his ability a super low CD flash?" and made a champ from that.

The problem with Flash is that it gives mobility to champions who are designed to not have any (Darius for instance) so for squishy champions to escape from them they need to have even more mobility on top of flash, and the guys designed to kill those squishes need even more mobility to be able to deal with them, thus a mobility creep was created just because Riot tough they could make people NOT want to use flash, they created something and then refused to see that it was extremely toxic to the game, and that's something they told us themselves, right before saying that they couldn't remove flash anymore because it became a core part of the game, and if they did remove it would completely screw up the game balance.
